meanings.definition: (verb) to deposit eggs or larvae on (a host)
meanings.sent1: The flyblows on the fruit attracted more flies.
meanings.sent2: The farmer noticed the flyblows on the cow's back.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a flyblows party when the flies arrived.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a canvas for the flyblows to paint their next generation.
meanings.sent5: The flyblows on the window were like tiny time bombs waiting to hatch.

meanings.definition: (noun) the eggs or larvae of a fly
meanings.sent1: She carefully removed the flyblows from the meat before cooking.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the flyblows under a microscope.
meanings.sent3: The flyblows in the compost bin were having a family reunion.
meanings.sent4: The field was a sea of green, dotted with tiny flyblows.
meanings.sent5: The flyblows wriggled and squirmed, eager to begin their transformation.
